page.title: 11THE FIRE STATION
page.content: When we arrived, the firemen drove the fire engine outside for us to look at. They showed us the fire fighting equipment and protective clothing. A fireman put on the oxygen tank and mask to show us how to breathe during a fire. Inside we saw the telephone, the sirens and other apparatus. We tried on the firemen's helmets and then the firemen got out the hoses and let us have turns in spraying water. Suddenly there was a fire call to London Road so we had to stand back whilst the firemen dashed into the engine and rushed off. They were very well organised, sliding down a pole and dressing as they ran so that they didn't waste any time. On the way back to school we looked for fire hydrants and counted six in the mile or so between Wiltshire Road and school. It was a very enjoyable visit.
